div1.p: Acknowledging a note and offering to pay in cattle

Your note of the 27th was handed me by Mr. Henry Jones, on the subject of the note you mention, I have only to say, it is just, and I am as willing to pay it to you as to any other person, and have no objection to your purchasing it— I was informed by H. Jones that you were desirous of purchasing some cattle, I will sell you one hundred head, to be made up of cows, three year old steers, two year old Steers and yearlings, to be composed of Heiffers and steers, equal numbers of each sort mentioned, throwing in the calves,—at six dollars per head— Or I will let you have the number that will discharge the note. Should you accede to either of these propositions, you may come immediately, close the bargain, and receive your cattle—
